com.ibm.xmi.framework
Class XMIFiles

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.xmi.framework.XMIFiles
public class XMIFiles
extends java.lang.Object

An XMIFiles object represents a collection of XMI files that have cross-file references. You also use this class when loading files so the framework will match the objects and values in the files to their definers.

When you use this class to load XMI files, the framework will automatically replace proxies for objects with the actual objects when they are loaded.

If you query an object proxy for data, and the object proxy was created as a result of loading an XMI file using this class, the framework will automatically attempt to load the file the object is in so it can return the data from the object. This process is called demand loading. The default is for demand loading to be enabled, but you can disable it if you wish.

If you add an XMIFiles object to a workspace, the framework will attempt to match the objects, properties, and links to their definers in the workspace. See the Workspace class for more details.

Constructor Detail

XMIFiles

public XMIFiles()
Method Detail

get

public XMIObject get(java.lang.String uuid)
This method is used by the framework to resolve cross-file references, since the framework produces cross-file references that are based on uuids. The XMI object returned by this method is either a proxy for an object or the actual object.
Returns:
Null or the XMI object with the given uuid

getContainer

public XMIContainer getContainer()
All objects loaded from XMI files using this XMIFiles object are put in an XMIContainer so the framework can perform demand loading and resolve cross-file references by replacing proxies for objects with the actual objects.
Returns:
The XMIContainer that holds all objects created from all XMI files loaded with this XMIFiles object

isDemandLoad

public boolean isDemandLoad()
You can enable or disable demand loading by using the setDemandLoad method.
Returns:
True if demand load is enabled; false otherwise.

getFilepath

public java.lang.String getFilepath()
See the setFilepath method for details about the format of the filepath.
Returns:
The file path

getFiles

public java.util.Collection getFiles()
Each XMIFile that is created by loading using this XMIFiles object is stored in a collection which you can access using this method.
Returns:
An empty collection or an unmodifiable collection of XMIFile objects

getWorkspace

public Workspace getWorkspace()
Returns:
The workspace for this XMIFiles object

load

public XMIFile load(java.lang.String filename,
                    int option,
                    boolean validate)
             throws java.lang.Exception
You should use this method if you want the framework to resolve cross-file references, to match the constructs in XMI files with their definers when loading, or to automatically load XMI files if you query for information that must come from the objects rather than proxies (demand loading).

If there is a cross-file reference to an object in another file, the framework will create an XMIObject whose proxy property is true. If the file containing the actual object is subsequently loaded using this object, the proxy will be replaced by the actual object.

The framework puts all objects loaded from files using this XMIFiles object into an XMIContainer.

If this XMIFiles object was previously added to a workspace, the framework will match the objects, properties, and links from the XMI file with definers from models that have been added to the workspace.

Parameters:
filename - The filename; if a filepath is set, it is searched to determine what file to open.
option - The only currently available option is XMIFiles.DEFAULT.
validate - If true, a validating SAX parser is used; if false, a non-validating SAX parser is used

load

public XMIFile load(java.lang.String filename,
                    java.io.InputStream stream,
                    int option,
                    boolean validate)
             throws java.lang.Exception
This load method lets you provide an open input stream that is used to load an XMI file. For more details, see the documentation for the other load method for this class.
Parameters:
filename - The filename; if a filepath is set, it is searched to determine what file to open.
stream - An open input stream
option - The only currently available option is XMIFiles.DEFAULT.
validate - If true, a validating SAX parser is used; if false, a non-validating SAX parser is used

loadAll

public void loadAll()
Make sure that there are no proxies--load all of the files related to the file(s) previously loaded. For now, framework users can't do this--but maybe they should be able to in the future, or maybe there should be a load option to accomplish this.

setWorkspace

public void setWorkspace(Workspace w)
You can set the workspace for an XMIFiles object if you wish, but there is normally no reason for you to do so, since the framework automatically invokes this method when you add an XMIFiles object to a Workspace.
Parameters:
w - The workspace

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

setDemandLoad

public void setDemandLoad(boolean value)
By default, the framework will demand load XMI files if you load XMI files with cross-file references using this class, but you can turn it off if you wish.
Parameters:
value - True if you want the framework to demand load; false otherwise.

setFilepath

public void setFilepath(java.lang.String filepath)
A file path consists of directories and zip files separated by semi-colons. The framework will search the directories and zip files in the order they appear in the filepath.
Parameters:
filepath - The file path
